author: @eldeber
title: ONU otorga Premio a Libertad de Prensa a periodistas en Gaza | El Deber
text: ONU otorga Premio a Libertad de Prensa a periodistas en Gaza La UNESCO dio su â€˜Premio Mundial a la Libertad de Prensaâ€™ a todas las personas palestinas que ejercen el periodismo en Gaza. La UNESCO otorgÃ³ el jueves (02.05.2024) su Premio Mundial a la Libertad de Prensa a todas las personas de origen palestino que ejercen el periodismo en Gaza, diezmadas desde hace casi siete meses por la ofensiva israelÃ­ en el territorio, tras el ataque del grupo terrorista HamÃ¡s en Israel. "En estos tiempos de oscuridad y desesperanza, queremos transmitir un firme mensaje de solidaridad y reconocimiento a los periodistas palestinos que estÃ¡n cubriendo esta crisis en circunstancias tan dramÃ¡ticas", declarÃ³ el chileno Mauricio Weibel, presidente del Jurado Internacional de profesionales de los medios de comunicaciÃ³n. "Como humanidad, tenemos una enorme deuda con su valentÃ­a y su compromiso con la libertad de expresiÃ³n", aÃ±adiÃ³ en un comunicado. Audrey Azoulay -directora general de la organizaciÃ³n de Naciones Unidas para la EducaciÃ³n, la Ciencia y la Cultura- destacÃ³ por su parte "la importancia del compromiso colectivo para garantizar que los periodistas de todo el mundo puedan seguir llevando a cabo su labor esencial de informar e investigar". SegÃºn el ComitÃ© para la ProtecciÃ³n de Periodistas (CPJ), con sede en Nueva York, al menos 97 reporteros -en su mayorÃ­a (92) palestinos- han sido asesinados desde que estallÃ³ la guerra entre Israel y HamÃ¡s el 7 de octubre de 2023. Otros 16 resultaron heridos. El conflicto estallÃ³ cuando comandos de HamÃ¡s atacaron el sur de Israel, matando a 1.170 personas, en su mayorÃ­a civiles, segÃºn un balance de la agencia AFP basado en datos israelÃ­es. Asimismo, mÃ¡s de 250 personas fueron secuestradas. Israel afirma que 129 siguen en Gaza, de las cuales 34 habrÃ­an muerto. En respuesta, Israel prometiÃ³ "aniquilar" a HamÃ¡s y lanzÃ³ una ofensiva que dejÃ³ hasta el momento 34.596 muertes en Gaza, en su mayorÃ­a civiles, segÃºn el Ministerio de Salud del territorio, gobernado por el movimiento islamista.

author: Jenna Anderson
title: Paramount+ Cancels Wolf Pack After One Season
text:
Paramount+ Cancels Wolf Pack After One Season
Sarah Michelle Gellar's Teen Wolf offshoot will not return for Season 2.
The latest extension of the Teen Wolf franchise has been declawed. On Thursday, reports confirmed that a second season of
[Wolf Pack](/category/wolf-pack/), the series that spun out of the events of 2022's [Teen Wolf: The Movie](/category/teen-wolf-the-movie-noncomicmovie/), is no longer in the works at Paramount+. Wolf Pack, which starred and was executive produced by Buffy the Vampire Slayer star [Sarah Michelle Gellar](/category/sarah-michelle-gellar-actor/), premiered its first season in early 2023. According to the reporting surrounding the cancellation, the decision was partially made after production delays caused by last year's actors and writers strikes meant that Season 2 of Wolf Pack wouldn't premiere until 2025. That extended hiatus would reportedly require Paramount+ to spend more money to market Season 2.
"Well, after just about a full year of uncertainty, the hammer finally fell today in Hollywood and news came out that Wolf Pack has been officially cancelled," Edo Van Belkom, who wrote the Wolf Pack novel the series was based on, wrote on social media. Disappointing, of course, especially since all signs pointed to there being a season two. But, while the show was a success, the WGA strike, followed by the SAG strike did the series no favors... I'm sad myself, season two was going to see me have a cameo and another set visit, but I was just having fun and playing in Hollywood for a bit. I feel more for the young actors and others who felt this was going to be their big break."
Well, after just about a full year of uncertainty, the hammer finally fell today in Hollywood and news came out that Wolf Pack has been officially cancelled.â€” Edo van Belkom (@EdovanBelkom)
[pic.twitter.com/kP8pqNUbn2] [January 24, 2024]
What Is Wolf Pack About?
Wolf Pack follows a teenage boy and girl whose lives are changed forever when a California wildfire awakens a terrifying supernatural creature and drives it to attack a highway traffic jam beneath the burning hills. Wounded in the chaos, the boy and girl are inexplicably drawn to each other and to two other teenagers who were adopted sixteen years earlier by a park ranger after another mysterious wildfire. As the full moon rises, all four teens come together to unravel the secret that connects them â€“ the bite and blood of a werewolf. In addition to Gellar,
the cast of Wolf Pack consisted of Armani Jackson, Bella Shepard, Chloe Rose Robertson, Tyler Lawrence Gray, Rodrigo Santoro, and Chase Liefeld.
"There is definitely a path that he could follow. There's definitely a lot of things that have already happened that can play out that we can see on screen," Liefeld
previously told ComicBook.com about a potential Season 2 of Wolf Pack. "Integrating into society, coming to terms with what he's done, all these things. He's definitely got a lot of things he'll be fighting [in a possible] next season. Maybe physically, maybe mentally. There's going to be no shortage of obstacles in his way if season two does come along. We'll see what happens."
What do you think of Wolf Pack being cancelled by Paramount+? Are you sad that the series won't be getting a Season 2? Share your thoughts with us in the comments below!
[0comments](#)

author: @keycnewsnow
title: FIRST ALERT: Snow tonight, major winter storm possible by late weekend
text: FIRST ALERT: Snow tonight, major winter storm possible by late weekend We are tracking two winter storm systems that combined could very well double our current seasonal snowfall total, which stands at 9.4 inches. The first system will bring a couple of inches, perhaps a little more, to the Mankato area from late this evening into Friday morning. There is a winter weather advisory for counties north and east of the Mankato area where amounts will be slightly higher. The second system could very well be our most significant winter storm system so far this winter season. There is a high likelihood of a long-duration winter storm system, which could produce heavy snow, strong winds, rain, and even some ice. Snow will begin late Saturday night into Sunday morning with precipitation continuing through Monday night and possibly even through most of Tuesday. We have a lot to talk about. Here is a detailed breakdown of the two systems. TONIGHT / FRIDAY MORNING Timing: Snow will develop across far western Minnesota late Thursday afternoon and develop east and southeastward into Thursday evening. Snow is expected to reach the Mankato area by mid-Thursday evening, continuing through the night and ending around or shortly after daybreak on Friday. Snow will exit from northwest to southeast Friday morning. A second band of snow is likely along and south of I-90 late tonight. This band will start as rain but change to snow as temperatures drop overnight. Snowfall amounts here will depend on when the rain changes to snow. Amounts: In the Mankato area, snowfall amounts will be around 2 inches, with some locations getting up to three inches. Amounts will gradually be higher north and east of Mankato with lesser amounts to the west and south. The exception to the south will be locations along and south of I-90 where an enhanced area of precipitation will develop late tonight. Precipitation will begin as rain but is expected to change to snow. Snow amounts will depend on when that change happens. If it happens earlier, snow amounts will be higher. Snow forecast as of 2pm Wednesday 3/20/2024: Here are the latest Watches, Warnings and Advisories: LATE SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY The second system we are tracking is much more significant and will likely be the most impactful winter storm weâ€™ve had so far this winter season. Based on our latest long-range forecast model data, a 6+ inch snowfall event is looking more and more likely. Itâ€™s still early, making it too soon to pinpoint where the heaviest snow will fall. However, current estimates suggest a â€œlow endâ€ range of 3 to 6 inches and a â€œhigh endâ€ range of 8 to 12 inches. We will probably end up somewhere in between, but this could all change based on where the system develops, where it ends up tracking, and how much precipitation falls as snow versus rain. Those are all things that we wonâ€™t be able to narrow down for another couple of days. In regard to timing, snow could potentially start as early as Saturday evening with the potential for heavy snow Sunday and Sunday night. During that time, it will also be very windy with easterly gusts of 40+ mph. Warmer air will wrap into the system Sunday night into Monday, at which point snow will change to rain. Rain will be likely through much of Monday, with rain changing back to snow with colder air on the backside of the system Monday night through Tuesday. Keep in mind, all of this is very preliminary as we are still several days away from the onset of this system. That said, if you have travel plans from late Saturday through early next week, check the weather and check it often because it is looking more and more likely that you will have to make some changes. Download the KEYC First Alert weather app for the latest updates from your team of local meteorologists. We will be watching everything very closely and will have updates all along the way. [Click here to download the KEYC News Now app or our KEYC First Alert weather app.](https://www.keyc.com/page/keyc-apps-for-ios-and-android-devices/) Copyright 2024 KEYC. All rights reserved.

author: Joseph S. Pete joseph.pete@nwi.com, 219-933-3316
title: United Steelworkers union meets to discuss oil bargaining goals
text:
The United Steelworkers union and oil companies that employ union members will soon begin negotiating new contracts, including for workers at the BP Whiting Refinery.
The USW convened its National Oil Bargaining Conference in Pittsburgh this week to prepare for negotiations. Union leaders from around the world met to discuss priorities, goals and strategy going into the latest round of contract talks.
"Delegates from each local union met in regional and employer groups to talk about the top issues impacting you," the USW said in an update to members. "These meetings help shape our national bargaining goals."
The USW's elected policy committee then met to develop a proposed national bargaining agenda that factors in ideas pitched by local union representatives.
The new contract will cover most of the about 1,800 workers at the BP Whiting Refinery, setting their pay, benefits, safety training, safety guidelines and other working conditions.
The union negotiated the current contract in 2022. It included 12% raises.
Union leaders spent the week in Pittsburgh taking part in workshops on labor law, mid-contract negotiations and strike preparation. They discussed and refined a national bargaining agenda that will guide the contract talks with BP, Shell, ExxonMobil and other oil companies.
The USW voted Thursday to adopt the union's 2026 National Oil Bargaining policy, and will present it to all members to review and ratify.
"BP looks forward to negotiating five contracts with the USW in January 2026," company spokesman Cesar Rodriguez said. "We remain committed to bargaining in good faith and will continue to focus on the best interests of Whiting and our local operations."

author: EIN News
title: The Law Office of David E. Gordon Achieves 100% Attorney Board Certification - Patents and Trademarks Today - EIN Presswire
text:
The Law Office of David E. Gordon Achieves 100% Attorney Board Certification Elissa M. Coombs, The Law Office of David E. Gordon
Fewer than 2 percent of Tennessee lawyers hold Board Certification, and now, the Law Office of David E. Gordon proudly boasts a 100% Board-Certified team
MEMPHIS, TENNESSEE, UNITED STATES, December 28, 2023 / EINPresswire.com / -- The Law Office of David E. Gordon proudly announces that Elissa M. Coombs , an esteemed litigation attorney, has attained Board Certification as a Civil Practice Advocate by the National Board of Trial Advocacy. This distinction marks a remarkable achievement in legal excellence for Ms. Coombs and makes the firmâ€™s practicing legal team 100% board certified, a distinction fewer than 2 percent of Tennessee lawyers hold.
Board Certification stands as one of the most rigorous and reputable distinctions an attorney can achieve. It reflects the thorough examination of an attorney's skills, experience, and integrity by a national board of experts, providing the public confidence that a particular lawyer has the tools and talent to provide excellent representation.
To become board-certified, Elissa underwent a comprehensive evaluation process. This included submitting names of judges and lawyers for independent verification of her skills, passing a rigorous day-long written examination, presenting actual copies of her legal work for review, and providing documentation of active involvement in at least 100 court cases.
Before joining the firm, she worked for 17 years as a defense attorney, primarily handling maritime cases. Elissaâ€™s work as a defense attorney gives her unique insight into how insurance companies evaluate and defend personal injury cases.
Elissa is admitted to practice in all Tennessee and Mississippi state courts, numerous United States District Courts, and both the Fifth and Sixth Circuit United States Courts of Appeals. Elissa also has been certified as a Proctor in Admiralty by the Maritime Law Association of the United States.
Certification is a critical factor in negotiating with insurance companies, demonstrating a lawyer's capability to handle cases effectively. This distinction ensures that the firmâ€™s attorneys possess the tools and talent necessary to provide outstanding representation. For clients, this can translate to fair compensation and the knowledge that their attorney can pursue trial if necessary.
###
About The Law Office of David E. Gordon
The Law Office of David E. Gordon is a full-service personal injury law firm. We are proud to be part of the 2% of Tennessee Lawyers Board Certified by the Tennessee Supreme Court. David Gordon has provided clients with outstanding legal representation in Memphis since 2001. We handle a variety of incidents including, car wrecks, motorcycle accidents, truck collisions, slips and falls, wrongful death, dog bites, and more.
David E. Gordon
The Law Office of David E. Gordon
+1 (901) 444-4444

text:

La guerre au Soudan et la crise humanitaire qui continue de sâ€™aggraver. Dâ€™aprÃ¨s les Nations unies, le conflit a provoquÃ© la plus importante crise alimentaire au monde et les premiers cas de famine dÃ©clarÃ©e depuis 2017. PrÃ¨s de 25 millions de Soudanais souffrent dâ€™insÃ©curitÃ© alimentaire aigÃ¼e, soit prÃ¨s de la moitiÃ© de la population du pays. PubliÃ© le :
Avec notre envoyÃ©e spÃ©ciale au Soudan, GaÃ«lle Laleix
Devant la mosquÃ©e du quartier de Burri Ã  Khartoum, la capitale du Soudan, HaÃ¯thiam Mohammed Alawad distribue de grandes gamelles de haricots rouges. Il gÃ¨re cette soupe populaire depuis le dÃ©but de la guerre. Â« On a cuisinÃ© beaucoup de lÃ©gumes, des haricots. On a aussi de la salade. On fournit le petit dÃ©jeuner, le dÃ©jeuner et du riz pour le dÃ®ner. Environ 190 personnes viennent chaque jour. On note les repas sur une carte Â».
Burri est dÃ©vastÃ© par les combats et les pillages. Pour ses habitants, comme Habib Mohammed Ali Mustapha, la soupe populaire reprÃ©sente le seul moyen de survivre. Â« On nâ€™a ni argent, ni nourriture chez moi. Je nâ€™ai jamais quittÃ© Khartoum. Durant toute la guerre, je suis venu chercher ma nourriture ici. Tous les habitants du quartier, on venait se nourrir ici. Deux repas chaque jour Â».
La soupe populaire financÃ©e par la diaspora
Ce sont les Soudanais de la diaspora qui financent les soupes populaires de la capitale. Mahmoud Salah, ingÃ©nieur, vient chaque jour. Il nâ€™a pas les moyens de suivre lâ€™inflation. Â« La nourriture coÃ»te trÃ¨s cher, car on est dans une pÃ©riode dâ€™aprÃ¨s-guerre. 1 kilo de viande coÃ»te 24 000 livres soudanaises. Aujourdâ€™hui, 6 pains coÃ»tent 1 000 livres soudanaises. Avant, on en achetait 24 pour le mÃªme prix. La diffÃ©rence est Ã©norme Â».
Dâ€™aprÃ¨s le Programme alimentaire mondiale, le prix du panier moyen au Soudan, a augmentÃ© de 134% en un an.
